page.title: 02TRAFFIC SURVEY INTRODUCTION
page.content: The most significant feature within this sector is the road network. Between 09:15 and 10:00 on Thursday 28th June 1985 30 13 year old pupils from Theale Green School conducted a traffic survey of the roundabout just west of Theale. The technique used was to write down the numbers on the number plate of every vehicle entering and leaving the roundabout on each of the five roads. Work in the classroom afterwards allowed the pupils to calculate the traffic flow. Despite the fact that the morning rush hour was over, 1,589 vehicles used the roundabout in the 45 minutes during which the survey was being conducted. As will be seen from the following five pages, the traffic flow was largely predictable with the great majority of vehicles using the main east-west routes.
